body:
> > 我尝试使用dolphinscheduler框架现在实现的cron表达式无法实现状态的继续，您知道怎么利用现在的机制去实现我上边的描述吗？
> > The logic of cron is that if it exceeds 60, it will be reset. At the beginning of the time you set, every 59 will cause the next execution to exceed 60. You can set it to execute every 2 minutes. Starting from 30 minutes, you probably know cron Logic
> > cron的逻辑是如果超过60就会重置，下个周期从你设置的时间的开始，每隔59都会导致下次执行超过60，你可以设置每隔2分钟执行，从30分钟开始，你就大概知道cron的逻辑

In addition, I want to know what kind of business needs you need to implement in this way
另外，我想知道你们哪种业务场景，需要采用这种方式执行

> > 我尝试使用dolphinscheduler框架现在实现的cron表达式无法实现状态的继续，您知道怎么利用现在的机制去实现我上边的描述吗？
> > The logic of cron is that if it exceeds 60, it will be reset. At the beginning of the time you set, every 59 will cause the next execution to exceed 60. You can set it to execute every 2 minutes. Starting from 30 minutes, you probably know cron Logic
> > cron的逻辑是如果超过60就会重置，下个周期从你设置的时间的开始，每隔59都会导致下次执行超过60，你可以设置每隔2分钟执行，从30分钟开始，你就大概知道cron的逻辑

问题时我需要每7分钟执行，每13分钟执行这种周期，而且是需要能够跨小时持续状态的，dolphinscheduler可以实现吗？
感觉很多场景的调度周期都无法实现

> > > 我尝试使用dolphinscheduler框架现在实现的cron表达式无法实现状态的继续，您知道怎么利用现在的机制去实现我上边的描述吗？
> > > The logic of cron is that if it exceeds 60, it will be reset. At the beginning of the time you set, every 59 will cause the next execution to exceed 60. You can set it to execute every 2 minutes. Starting from 30 minutes, you probably know cron Logic
> > > cron的逻辑是如果超过60就会重置，下个周期从你设置的时间的开始，每隔59都会导致下次执行超过60，你可以设置每隔2分钟执行，从30分钟开始，你就大概知道cron的逻辑
> 
> In addition, I want to know what kind of business needs you need to implement in this way
> 另外，我想知道你们哪种业务场景，需要采用这种方式执行

1.比如我们需要程序调起来的时候用当前的时间戳，往前倒20分钟，来确定读取的时间范围。
2.调度的程序就是需要持续之前的调度状态，但我们的dolphinscheduler就是不支持这样，很多调度平台都支持俩种定时器，一个是cron表达式，另外一种是可以持续状态的调度。

because shell task can submit many yarn task，the task runtime log will return many application ids

---
因为 shell 任务类型可以写多个 MR 任务，这样的话，这个shell任务的运行日志里会返回多个 application id
please show entire log, I can't find problems from the log
By the way, zookeeper service is started already?
I like this Feature
please see the runtime log on worker server to find out  the exit code for this task, exit code = 0 means success, not 0 means failure
by the way , please update/add title in English, thx
hi， do you have any ideas on how to solve this problem?
It is a good feature.

> > > > 我尝试使用dolphinscheduler框架现在实现的cron表达式无法实现状态的继续，您知道怎么利用现在的机制去实现我上边的描述吗？
> > > > The logic of cron is that if it exceeds 60, it will be reset. At the beginning of the time you set, every 59 will cause the next execution to exceed 60. You can set it to execute every 2 minutes. Starting from 30 minutes, you probably know cron Logic
> > > > cron的逻辑是如果超过60就会重置，下个周期从你设置的时间的开始，每隔59都会导致下次执行超过60，你可以设置每隔2分钟执行，从30分钟开始，你就大概知道cron的逻辑
> > 
> > 
> > In addition, I want to know what kind of business needs you need to implement in this way
> > 另外，我想知道你们哪种业务场景，需要采用这种方式执行
> 
> 1.比如我们需要程序调起来的时候用当前的时间戳，往前倒20分钟，来确定读取的时间范围。
> 2.调度的程序就是需要持续之前的调度状态，但我们的dolphinscheduler就是不支持这样，很多调度平台都支持俩种定时器，一个是cron表达式，另外一种是可以持续状态的调度。

At present, the ds you mentioned is really not supported. I think the question you raised is very good. In addition, do you have any good implementation plans and suggestions for supporting the continuous state? We will improve this function in the future
目前，你说的这个ds确实是不支持，我觉的你提的这个问题非常好，另外，你对支持持续状态有什么好的实现方案和建议么，后续我们将对这个功能进行改进

Please change the issue title to english !

Thrank you !
Hi , any ideas on how to solve this problem? I have the same problem

Thank you for your pr.

Now, yarn queue can only be associate to tenant（租户），the tenant is a hadoop user in a hadoop cluster . 
The yarn queue must be real and the hadoop user must have permission to submit jobs to the yarn queue.
Therefore, I think, if possible, the yarn queue that can be selected when creating the mr task must be the yarn queue associated with the tenant corresponding to the user.

In addition, the current tenant and yarn queue have a one-to-one relationship. So, it is meaningless to let users choose yarn queue. If a tenant can associate multiple yarn queues, it is a good idea to let users choose yarn queue when creating mr tasks.

Thank you for your pr.

Now, yarn queue can only be associate to tenant（租户），the tenant is a hadoop user in a hadoop cluster . 
The yarn queue must be real and the hadoop user must have permission to submit jobs to the yarn queue.
Therefore, I think, if possible, the yarn queue that can be selected when creating the mr task must be the yarn queue associated with the tenant corresponding to the user.

In addition, the current tenant and yarn queue have a one-to-one relationship. So, it is meaningless to let users choose yarn queue. If a tenant can associate multiple yarn queues, it is a good idea to let users choose yarn queue when creating mr tasks.

> Thank you for your pr.
> 
> Now, yarn queue can only be associate to tenant（租户），the tenant is a hadoop user in a hadoop cluster .
> The yarn queue must be real and the hadoop user must have permission to submit jobs to the yarn queue.
> Therefore, I think, if possible, the yarn queue that can be selected when creating the mr task must be the yarn queue associated with the tenant corresponding to the user.
> 
> In addition, the current tenant and yarn queue have a one-to-one relationship. So, it is meaningless to let users choose yarn queue. If a tenant can associate multiple yarn queues, it is a good idea to let users choose yarn queue when creating mr tasks.

----------------------------------

In most of the yarn clusters, multi queue is used

Now, a user can only use one queue, if you want to use other queues, there is no way

It is very common that a user can use multiple queues, so this pr .
If not, the PR will be turned off .

> If not, the PR will be turned off .

No, I think this feature is good. But you should make the  tenant can associate multiple yarn queues first and the yarn queue that can be selected when creating the mr task must be the yarn queue associated with the tenant corresponding to the user.

> > If not, the PR will be turned off .
> 
> No, I think this feature is good. But you should make the tenant can associate multiple yarn queues first and the yarn queue that can be selected when creating the mr task must be the yarn queue associated with the tenant corresponding to the user.

--------------------------------------------------------

In my opinion, I want to weaken the concept of tenants

As a strategy, tenants choose when performing tasks

Resource files are no longer stored on tenants, but are stored by project

Therefore, tenants are no longer strongly associated with users



Tenant and yarn queue are the same, can be configured at the time of execution



Of course, you can use authority to control and divide it to users



A user can use multiple tenants

A user can use more than one yarn queue



What's your opinion?

**Resource files are no longer stored on tenants, but are stored by project** 
Tenants is necessary . because every user run task, upload files to hdfs must use a hadoop user to do this. we know every file in hdfs must ower by a hadoop user(tenants). If one user can can multiple tenants, when he upload resource file to hdfs, which hadoop user(tenants) is the file ower? Do we need to select tenants when saving resource files?

> **Resource files are no longer stored on tenants, but are stored by project**
> Tenants is necessary . because every user run task, upload files to hdfs must use a hadoop user to do this. we know every file in hdfs must ower by a hadoop user(tenants). If one user can can multiple tenants, when he upload resource file to hdfs, which hadoop user(tenants) is the file ower? Do we need to select tenants when saving resource files?

---------------


I'm talking about weakening tenants, not deleting them

Now the files are stored in HDFS, which is divided by tenant

In fact, if divided by project, it can also meet the needs

Now the implementation of the middle platform system, resources storage by project is more in line with the needs of tenants



The tenant is only responsible for the execution rights of tasks, not for storage

> > **Resource files are no longer stored on tenants, but are stored by project**
> > Tenants is necessary . because every user run task, upload files to hdfs must use a hadoop user to do this. we know every file in hdfs must ower by a hadoop user(tenants). If one user can can multiple tenants, when he upload resource file to hdfs, which hadoop user(tenants) is the file ower? Do we need to select tenants when saving resource files?
> 
> I'm talking about weakening tenants, not deleting them
> 
> Now the files are stored in HDFS, which is divided by tenant
> 
> In fact, if divided by project, it can also meet the needs
> 
> Now the implementation of the middle platform system, resources storage by project is more in line with the needs of tenants
> 
> The tenant is only responsible for the execution rights of tasks, not for storage

If users and tenants are one-to-one, resource files can be organized by tenants and by projects. Of course, it is best to organize by projects.
If the user and the tenant are not one-to-one, the user must choose which tenant to upload when uploading files to hdfs.

So I think user and the tenant are one-to-one is necessary. Based on this premise, the organization of resource files by project is the best.

Kudos, SonarCloud Quality Gate passed! > > > **Resource files are no longer stored on tenants, but are stored by project**
> > > Tenants is necessary . because every user run task, upload files to hdfs must use a hadoop user to do this. we know every file in hdfs must ower by a hadoop user(tenants). If one user can can multiple tenants, when he upload resource file to hdfs, which hadoop user(tenants) is the file ower? Do we need to select tenants when saving resource files?
> > 
> > 
> > I'm talking about weakening tenants, not deleting them
> > Now the files are stored in HDFS, which is divided by tenant
> > In fact, if divided by project, it can also meet the needs
> > Now the implementation of the middle platform system, resources storage by project is more in line with the needs of tenants
> > The tenant is only responsible for the execution rights of tasks, not for storage
> 
> If users and tenants are one-to-one, resource files can be organized by tenants and by projects. Of course, it is best to organize by projects.
> If the user and the tenant are not one-to-one, the user must choose which tenant to upload when uploading files to hdfs.
> 
> So I think user and the tenant are one-to-one is necessary. Based on this premise, the organization of resource files by project is the best.

------------------


What if a user wants to have the rights of multiple tenants??



For example, execute Spark Program with spark tenant

Execute hive program with hive user

The root user is required to execute the system program



Today's programs are stored on tenants

Cross tenant execution procedures, resource files have to be authorized separately

If there are 100 projects, resource files refer to each other

How to manage resource files?

If the executive authority of the management program is ＂???

Looking forward to the development of dispatching...

> > > > **Resource files are no longer stored on tenants, but are stored by project**
> > > > Tenants is necessary . because every user run task, upload files to hdfs must use a hadoop user to do this. we know every file in hdfs must ower by a hadoop user(tenants). If one user can can multiple tenants, when he upload resource file to hdfs, which hadoop user(tenants) is the file ower? Do we need to select tenants when saving resource files?
> > > 
> > > 
> > > I'm talking about weakening tenants, not deleting them
> > > Now the files are stored in HDFS, which is divided by tenant
> > > In fact, if divided by project, it can also meet the needs
> > > Now the implementation of the middle platform system, resources storage by project is more in line with the needs of tenants
> > > The tenant is only responsible for the execution rights of tasks, not for storage
> > 
> > 
> > If users and tenants are one-to-one, resource files can be organized by tenants and by projects. Of course, it is best to organize by projects.
> > If the user and the tenant are not one-to-one, the user must choose which tenant to upload when uploading files to hdfs.
> > So I think user and the tenant are one-to-one is necessary. Based on this premise, the organization of resource files by project is the best.
> 
> What if a user wants to have the rights of multiple tenants??
> 
> For example, execute Spark Program with spark tenant
> 
> Execute hive program with hive user
> 
> The root user is required to execute the system program
> 
> Today's programs are stored on tenants
> 
> Cross tenant execution procedures, resource files have to be authorized separately
> 
> If there are 100 projects, resource files refer to each other
> 
> How to manage resource files?
> 
> If the executive authority of the management program is ＂???
> 
> Looking forward to the development of dispatching...

After talking, we found that the key question is whether the resource file needs to have permission, whether the resource file in a project is shared by all users, whether the resource file between different projects is shared, if so, then we can use a tenant (this tenant is not associated with any users and is only used by ds to manage resource files) to organize resource files by project, and all users have common permissions to these resource files. Then the tenant associated with the user is only used to execute the task, so that the user and the tenant can be many-to-many, and the user can select the tenant and the yarn queue in the tenant to run the task.

> associated

If Kerberos is enabled, the tenant is useless

I think in the first stage we can allow tenants to add multiple queues, and then when creating tasks, we can select those queues of the tenant corresponding to the user. Regarding the issue of resource file management, we can create a new issue to discuss.

## PR的目的
- 该PR为工作流添加标签功能。 完成了controller, sercive, mapper三层的代码，以便可以独立完成标签简单的CRUD。还有添加和删除工作流的标签，并根据标签查找工作流等功能。
## 简要变更日志
- 创建 `t_ds_process_definiton_tags` 表以存储标签信息，例如 `TagName` `project_id` `user_id`。
   创建 `t_ds_relation_process_tag` 表以存储 `Tag` 和 `ProcessDefinition` 之间的关系。
- 添加 `Tag`  `ProcessTag` 类，`Tag` 和 `ProcessTag` 的 `controller` `sercive` `mapper` `xml` 的代码。 为了实现标签的验证权限，将`project_id` `user_id`字段添加到`t_ds_process_definiton_tags`表中，以模仿`ProcessDefinition`中的相似验证功能代码。
- `addProcessDefinitionTags`  `deleteProcessDefinitionTags`  `queryProcessDefinitionByTagId` 在`ProcessDefinitionService`中添加了三个新方法，以实现工作流添加，删除标签以及基于标签查询工作流。
## 验证这次PR
增加了测试，可以验证如下：
- 添加 `TagControllerTest` `TagServiceTest` `TagMapperTest`.
- 添加 `ProcessTagMapperTest`.
- 添加 在`controller` `sercive`层的 `testAddProcessDefinitionTags` `testDeleteProcessDefinitionTags` `testQueryProcessDefinitionByTagId.`

中文：
因为pull request #3053, t_ds_process_definition_version被添加进了sql里。
我把dolphin_api_service.py里的upgrade-dolphinscheduler删掉了，因为create-dolphinscheduler.sh对应的java代码CreateDolphinScheduler，其中已经有upgradeDolphinScheduler方法了

![截屏2020-09-28 下午4 56 44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11856719/94411979-cfaa1e00-01ab-11eb-898b-e350899c3903.png)

I think the problem is in the schema file. Not here.
In order to ensure that the table structure metadata is up to date, we need to execute the upgrade-dolphinscheduler.sh script at startup. This script will automatically check the current version number and execute the corresponding upgrade sql file.

Therefore, we require that the sql file in the schema must meet the ability of repeatable execution.
In order to achieve this goal, if we need to create the table t_ds_process_definition_version, then we should use 

```
create table IF NOT EXISTS t_ds_process_definition_version;

``` 
or

```
drop table if exists t_ds_process_definition_version;
create table t_ds_process_definition_version;

```

> I think the problem is in the schema file. Not here.
> In order to ensure that the table structure metadata is up to date, we need to execute the upgrade-dolphinscheduler.sh script at startup. This script will automatically check the current version number and execute the corresponding upgrade sql file.
> 
> Therefore, we require that the sql file in the schema must meet the ability of repeatable execution.
> In order to achieve this goal, if we need to create the table t_ds_process_definition_version, then we should use
> 
> ```
> create table IF NOT EXISTS t_ds_process_definition_version;
> ```
> 
> or
> 
> ```
> drop table if exists t_ds_process_definition_version;
> create table t_ds_process_definition_version;
> ```

Got it.
I fix it

After the spark application runs, ds will use the application_id to query the application status on yarn. The application_id is stored in the app_link field of the t_ds_task_instance table. There will be a log for querying the status of the yarn application in the task instance log of ds. Please check it.
